document_title: Intestinal infections: Symptoms, causes and prevention
subsection_name: nhiem-trung-duong-ruot.json_2_Who is at risk of intestinal infections?
subsection_content:
Below are 3 groups of people at highest risk of intestinal infections:
Young children and infants: This group has an incompletely developed immune system, so it is susceptible to attacks by bacteria, viruses, and parasites. Accordingly, the report shows that infectious diarrhea accounts for 1 in 9 deaths in children worldwide, with 2,195 cases per day, more than AIDS, malaria and measles combined.; Young children and infants: This group has an incompletely developed immune system, so it is susceptible to attacks by bacteria, viruses, and parasites. Accordingly, the report shows that infectious diarrhea accounts for 1 in 9 child deaths worldwide, with 2,195 cases per day, more than AIDS, malaria and measles combined.
Elderly people: This group has a weakened immune system and digestive system, so they are vulnerable to bacteria, viruses, and parasites; Elderly people: This group has a weakened immune system and digestive system, so they are vulnerable to bacteria, viruses, and parasites.
People living in unsanitary environments: This is a favorable environment for bacteria, viruses, and parasites to grow and spread quickly.; People living in unsanitary environments: This is a favorable environment for bacteria, viruses, and parasites to grow and spread quickly.
Children are one of the groups at risk of intestinal infections
